Meet me at the Boathouse Cafe Fort Victoria
Meet me at the Boathouse Cafe Fort Victoria Yarmouth
Wednesday 3rd July 10 am til 12 midday
My name is Ian Pickering and I am the Reform Party Candidate for Isle of Wight West. I am a retired teacher and resident of Freshwater. I am working closely with Sarah Morris who is our Candidate for Isle of Wight East. We want the best for the Island and believe that if you want change you have to vote for it.
As a Prospective Parliamentary Candidate I am self funding and you can help my campaign by visiting this site. https://gofund.me/84577b15
Watch my speech at the Riverside Centre in Newport on YouTube here
Visit my Facebook page here

Do you believe that the Conservative government has done a lot for Isle of Wight residents since 2010, especially over the last seven years?
If not, imagine what would happen if our Island had two Tory MPs after the General Election, sitting on the opposition benches (which we all know is where they would be).
There is now a real chance to change how the country is run for the better: vote Reform UK.
To learn more about the Reform Party vision for the UK
please go to "Our contract with You" a working draft document for you to comment upon and challenge. We value your views. https://www.reformparty.uk/policies
You can email me isleofwightwest@reformuk.com
or call 07553 011606 for more information and to volunteer to distribute leaflets in your area.
Do you live in West or East Wight? Check here if you are not sure.
Reform will lower your income tax by raising the tax threshold to £20,000.
This will put an an extra £30 or so in each earner's pocket every week.
The more you earn the more you can spend and the economy will grow.
We all know that without the skilled and dedicated staff from overseas, our hospitals, surgeries and all of our other health services would collapse. Similarly our building sites would not function, our hospitality industry would fail and much of our agricultural produce would not be harvested. A proper points system would allow us to control who comes into the country, where they are and what they are doing. The Government is currently spending £8 million per day housing illegal economic immigrants, whilst some of our own people are searching in vain for adequate accommodation. The boats must stop and those who are here illegally must be returned.
Our young people are our future. We need to secure their future for them by building an economy that will support and encourage them to succeed in whatever role they decide to play. They need to be able to train and develop skills relevant to the country's needs. We must invest in their future and not rely on importing a workforce from overseas.
Long-term planning and policies for the next five to twenty years will see our young people thrive in a country able to value and support them within a society proud of its history, culture and traditions.
